lines.text: Johnny...
Four weeks, twenty papers, that's two dollars. Plus tip.
Gee Johnny, I don't have a dime.
Didn't ask for a dime. Two dollars.
Well... it's funny see... my mom, had to leave early to take my brother to school and my dad to work cuz...
...two dollars... cash.

See... the problem here is that... my little brother, this morning, got his arm caught in the microwave, and uh... my grandmother dropped acid and she freaked out, and hijacked a school bus full of... penguins, so it's kind of a family crisis... so come back later? Great.
Two dollars!
I've been going to this high school for seven and a half years. I'm no dummy. I know high school girls.

[giving skiing instructions]
Go that way, really fast. If something gets in your way, turn.
This is pure snow! It's everywhere! Do you have any idea what the street value of this mountain is?
I want my two dollars!
Two brothers... One speaks no English, the other learned English from watching "The Wide World of Sports." So you tell me... Which is better, speaking no English at all, or speaking Howard Cosell?
[Lane waves to two tree trimmers from the cargo hold of a garbage truck]

[to fellow tree trimmer]
Now that's a real shame when folks be throwin' away a perfectly good white boy like that.
And dying when you're not really sick is really sick, you know. Really!
Gee, I'm real sorry your mom blew up, Ricky.

[indicating to Mrs. Smith's accident]
Gee, I'm really sorry your mom blew up, Ricky, guess she won't be able to eat any spicy foods for awhile.
She only speaks French, Roy. She doesn't speak imbecile.
I have great fear of tools. I once made a birdhouse in woodshop and the fair housing committee condemned it. I can't.
"I cannot do it" is your middle name.
So you won't tell anyone?
What, that you're a Dodgers fan?

[talking about skiing the K-12]
Look Charles, I gotta do this. If I don't, I'll be nothing. I'll end up like my neighbor Ricky Smith. He just sits around crocheting all day and snorting nasal spray.
He snorts nasal spray? Know where I can score some?
ARE YOU GONNA HELP ME OR NOT?
Uh, hello?
Ah, bonjour.
Monique, hi.
Comment allez-vous?
No thanks, I already had breakfast.
I figured if we had nothing to say to each other he would get bored; go away. But instead he uses it as an excuse to put his testicles all over me.
Excuse me?
You know, like octopus? Testicles?
Ohhhh. Tentacles. N-T. Tentacles; big Difference.
What's a little boy like you doing with big boy smut like this?
The K-12 dude. You make a gnarly run like that and girls will get sterile just looking at you.
Wait, wait a minute...
[starts to snort snow off his top hat]

[sniff]
Oh.
[shouts]
Oh! Ugh! Outrageous!
[raises right hand]

[shouts]
I think I just froze the left half of my brain!
[waves arm in circles]

[shouts]
Look! I can't move my right arm!
This isn't funny, Charles! If I don't have a dream, I have nothing!
Ah, come on! It's Christmas Eve! I could be home right now, drinking this *monster* eggnog my brother makes with lighter fluid.

[Indicates Monique]
Her?
Mm-hmm.

[Indicates Ricky]
And him?
Mmmm-hm.
That makes sense.
I think all you need is a small taste of success, and you will find it suits you.

[about Lane]
Man, you're the hottest thing since sunburns!

Truly a sight to behold. A man beaten. The once great champ, now, a study in moppishness. No longer the victory hungry stallion we've raced so many times before, but a pathetic, washed up, aged ex-champion.
Alright let's go!
[Crashes]
Frawnch fries.
Frawnch dressing.
Frawnch bread.
Ta-da! Peru.
Greendale is a bodaciously small town, Lane. A fly speck on the map - a rest stop on the way to the ski slope. I can't even get real drugs here!
[holds up a bottle of whipped cream]

[regarding the blob of food]
It's got raisins in it... you like raisins.
You look pretty stupid to me.
Thank you.
You'd make a fine little helper. What's your name?
Charles De Mar.
Shut up, geek.

[Imploring her son to fight with Lane]
Ricky, do something to him!
Hello Lane. How was your day?
Beth broke up with me.
Oh, heh, that's nice.

[ladles an unidentifiable gelatinous substance onto dinner plates]
I got the recipe from a magazine. The mail got wet in the rain, so some of the pages ran together, but what I couldn't read I just... improvised with my own little... creative ideas. It's got raisins in it. You *like* raisins.
I want my two dollars.
Suicide is never the answer, little trooper.
Buck up little camper, we'll beat that slope together.
Alright, who wants to hold my clipboard?
[Beth raises her hand]
Well you'll make a fine little helper. What's your name?

[Thinking Roy has referenced him]
Charles De Mar!
Shut up, geek.
[to Beth]
What's YOUR name?
Hello, Lane. How was your day?

[devastated]
Beth broke up with me.
Oh, that's nice.
One night with me and she'll probably go blind with ecstasy. Poor creature. Gee, I hope she doesn't grab onto my leg and start crying once the date's over. What would I do?
Monique, I just wanted to thank you... for everything.
Merci buckets.
Do you have Christmas in France?
[squeezing Monique's cheeks]
Chrisss-maaas! Christmas!
